seer 1.1.2
  • Reference

M4-Competition data

M4.Rd

The time series from the M4 forecasting competition.

M4

Format

M4 is a list of 100000 series of class Mcomp. Each series within M4 is of class Mdata with the following structure:

st

M4id (Series number and period). For example "Y1" denotes first yearly series, "Q20" denotes 20th quarterly series and so on.

n

The number of observations in the time series

h

The number of required forecasts

period

Interval of the time series. Possible values are "Yearly", "Quarterly", "Monthly", "Weekly", "Daily" and "Hourly".

type

The type of series. Possible values for M4 are "Industry", "Macro", "Micro", "Demographic", "Finance", "Other".

x

A time series of length n (the historical data)

Source

https://www.m4.unic.ac.cy/.

Examples

library(Mcomp)
#> Loading required package: forecast
#> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'Mcomp':
#>   method       from
#>   [.Mcomp      seer
#>   subset.Mcomp seer
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘Mcomp’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:seer’:
#> 
#>     subset.Mcomp
data(M4)
M4
#> M-Competition data: 100000 time series 
#> 
#>            Type of data
#> Period      DEMOGRAPHIC FINANCE INDUSTRY  MACRO  MICRO  OTHER  Total
#>   DAILY              10    1559      422    127   1476    633   4227
#>   HOURLY              0       0        0      0      0    414    414
#>   MONTHLY          5728   10987    10017  10016  10975    277  48000
#>   QUARTERLY        1858    5305     4637   5315   6020    865  24000
#>   WEEKLY             24     164        6     41    112     12    359
#>   YEARLY           1088    6519     3716   3903   6538   1236  23000
#>   Total            8708   24534    18798  19402  25121   3437 100000
plot(M4[[10000]]$x)
